question_content:
You manage a hardware store. You had just raised the price of gas-powered generators in your store when you received the email alert below.

“Effective immediately, Governor John Smith has issued a state of emergency in preparation for the severe snow storm beginning tonight. Expect icy roads, heavy snowfall, extreme cold, and power outages.”

According to the alert and the document shown, which of the following rationales would help prove that the new price was not “unreasonably excessive”?
answer_content: “The generators were more expensive for your store to get because of highway closures in areas already impacted by the storm.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: The new price was no higher than prices charged after storms in previous years.

choice.b: The generators were only available at your store, and they were still less expensive than similar models sold by other stores in the area.

choice.c: The generators were more expensive for your store to get because of highway closures in areas already impacted by the storm.

choice.d: The new price was set on a sliding scale, so only customers who could afford more had to pay more.

choice.e: The new price was increased to make up for sales lost because so many people stayed home during the storm.

question_content: Your team is redesigning the used-car website for AnyTown Car Sales and is planning a usability test. Based on the documents provided, which scenario would be best?

choice.d: You have just taken a job that requires a long commute, so you want to be able to connect your phone to the car's speakers for making calls and listening to music. Check out the new search filters, find some cars with wireless connections, and look for seats that are comfortable for tall people.

choice.e: You are looking for a new car and need to stick to a firm budget. Find a car that is a good deal. Explain what information on our website makes you confident you are getting a good deal.

question_content:
Q. Which of the following is an antonym to the word “stewardship” as it is used in this sentence?

VDOT's EMS ensures environmental stewardship for all of it employees. While there is still no intention to apply for the Environmental Management certification, the VDOT framework models after the Environmental Management Standard as a guide.

choice.a: Custodianship

choice.b: Approachability

choice.c: Negligence

choice.d: Responsiveness

choice.e:
Overseeing

Hint

Infer the meaning of the word and find its opposite.

question_content:
Q. Based on the following words, what is the meaning of the suffix “-ancy”?

tenancy, buoyancy, expectancy, poignancy, malignancy

choice.a: Denoting a quality or state

choice.b: Having an affliction or parasite

choice.c:
State of connection; being connected to

Hint

Make a best guess based on the words given.

question_content: Q. The word “ironclad” is defined as sheathed in iron plates for protection. Given this definition, why does the author choose the word for this sentence?

choice.a: The author aims to help the reader understand that the rule is less permanent (or “irreversible”) than it may seem.

choice.b: The author wants to show the strength of the rule as it applies to the joint tenancy agreement.

choice.c:
The author implies that the rule is not quite worthy of being “set in stone” or seared into one's memory.

Hint

Make a best guess based on the context.

question_content: Q. Given what you can infer about the prefix “uni,” what is the appropriate meaning of the word “unilaterally” in this sentence?

choice.a: Something that is done quickly.

choice.b: Involving one part or side of the argument.

choice.c:
A linear process for bringing something together.

Hint

Think about what you know about words that use the prefix “uni.” For example, “unicorn” is a mythical animal with one horn. A “uniform” is one style of clothing that many people must wear.

question_content: Q. The prefix “ab” means away or off from. What can you conclude about the word “abrogate” based on how it is used in this sentence?

choice.a: It relates to acceptance, e.g., accepting a situation.

choice.b: It has to do with stirring up a situation or aggravating something.

choice.c:
It relates to doing away with something, like repealing a law.

Hint

Think about what you know about words that use the prefix “ab.” For example, the word “abnormal' is used to denote something which is outside or away from the realm of normalness.

question_content: Q. This is a memo about daily tasks that was shared with Mort's Café Team Leads. For what reason is the Regional Management Team sending this email?

choice.a: The Management Team wants to increase pastry and coffee sales in the morning.

choice.b: The Management Team wants to make sure the Team Leads maintain cleanliness and customer service in the café.

choice.c:
The Management Team wants to share new rules for taking a customer's order during café hours.

Hint

Read the memo carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Here's a Lunch and Learn email invitation from Jason Hernandez. Why is Jason giving this Lunch and Learn to the company's employees?

choice.a: He wants to offer lunch to employees next Friday at 12:30pm.

choice.b: He wants to help employees keep their accounts secure with strong passwords.

choice.c:
He wants employees to connect their work and home accounts correctly.

Hint

Read the email carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. You want to add this Lunch and Learn to your calendar. Which statement gives the best summary of the purpose of the event?

choice.a: August 11th – Find out about computer safety and tools.

choice.b: August 11th – Lunch with Jason and friends.

choice.c:
August 11th – Learn about passwords and account protection. Lunch is included.

Hint

Read the email carefully to find the most important points.

question_content: Q. This is an email from the CEO of InkRight to staff. Imagine that you are an employee of the company. What is the most important takeaway the CEO wants you to know about the holiday weekend?

choice.a: My hard work has made this a very successful year for InkRight.

choice.b: The office will be closed on Wednesday, November 22nd.

choice.c:
I need to meet all client needs before I ask to leave early.

Hint

The main idea is located in the first paragraph.

question_content:
Q. Here is a set of instructions for sorting donations. The instructions were written for the employees of a local thrift store. Which sentence in the first paragraph best explains why these instructions are given?

Sorting Donations

Because we receive so many donations, they must be sorted every day. Not all donations should be sold. It is important that we sort donations correctly so that we can offer high-quality clothing.

First, sort donations into “Sell” and “Recycle” categories. Donations that are ripped, stained, stretched, dirty, or in bad condition must be placed in the white recycling crate. All other donations can be sold.

Sort the donations that can be sold into the blue bins along the back wall. These bins are marked with signs. Make sure you sort the donations correctly. For example, a woman's tee shirt should go into the “Women's Tees” bin, not “Women's Blouses.” See the photos above each bin for examples of what should be sorted there.

choice.a: Because we receive so many donations, they must be sorted every day.

choice.b: Not all donations should be sold.

choice.c:
It is important that we sort donations correctly so that we can offer high-quality clothing.

Hint

Read the entire set of instructions carefully. Then select the answer that best highlights the purpose for the instructions.

question_content: Q. According to this request, what should a manager include in their email to Joy Sundholm?

choice.a: Job title and salary details.

choice.b: Opening and closing dates for the posting.

choice.c:
Applicant instruction to send a cover letter and resume to a hiring manager.

Hint

Read the message carefully to find the correct answer.

question_content: Q. According to these network mapping directions, what is the main difference between accessing the shared drive in the office versus at home?

choice.a: In order to access the shared drive at home, you need to first connect to the VPN.

choice.b: In order to access the shared drive at home, you need to plug in to a network cable.

choice.c:
In order to access the shared drive at work, you need to first connect to the VPN.

Hint

Read the instructions carefully to find the correct answer.

question_content: Q. This policy was written to update employees on expectations for personal device usage while on the production floor. According to the policy, you can leave your cell phone with your supervisor or human resources specialist if:

choice.a: You want to check your phone during breaks.

choice.b: You were not assigned a locker or desk with storage.

choice.c:
You are expecting an urgent or important call and need to be alerted.

Hint

Read the policy carefully to find the correct answer.

question_content: Q. Imagine that you are working the register. Based on these instructions, if there are no customers waiting behind the customer at checkout, you should:

choice.a: Add a coupon book to the customer's bag.

choice.b: Provide a full explanation of the loyalty program.

choice.c:
Give the customer all the benefits of the loyalty program even though they are not a member.

Hint

Read the instructions carefully to find the correct answer.

question_content: Q. You are ringing up a new customer. When do you ask if they received help with their purchases from any employees?

choice.a: After scanning the bar codes of the items they are purchasing.

choice.b: After asking if they are in the loyalty program.

choice.c: Before logging in to the system.

choice.d:
As the customer hands you the items they want to purchase.

Hint

Read the instructions carefully to find the correct answer.

question_content: Q. Review this email from Jason Hernandez carefully. Which of the following topics will NOT be covered in the Lunch and Learn?

choice.a: The importance of using strong passwords

choice.b: Which tools to use to keep track of passwords

choice.c:
How to link your work and personal email accounts

Hint

Skim the email for clues and key words.

question_content: Q. According to the email, where should you use the information you will learn in the Lunch and Learn?

choice.a: In all work accounts and personal email

choice.b: In all client accounts and work email

choice.c:
In work, personal and bank accounts

Hint

Read the email carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. In his email, Jason asks you to let him know if you are coming to the Lunch and Learn so that he can order enough food. By when should you give him your decision?

choice.a: Reply to Jason by Friday at 10am, just before the Lunch and Learn starts.

choice.b: Reply to Jason by Monday. A specific “reply by” time is not given in the email.

choice.c:
Reply to Jason as soon as you finish reading his email.

Hint

Read the email carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. You are an employee at the local thrift store. What categories should you sort the donations into first?

choice.a: Sell and Bad Condition

choice.b: Sell and Recycle

choice.c:
High-Quality and Bad Condition

Hint

The categories are listed in the second paragraph.

question_content: Q. Where can you find information about what belongs in each of the blue bins located along the back wall?

choice.a: In the “Sell” donations instruction book, next to the blue bins.

choice.b: In the “Sell” donations instruction book, next to the white recycling crate.

choice.c:
In both the blue bin signs and the photos above each bin.

Hint

Read the third paragraph carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. You are an employee of InkRight Printing Corporation. According to the memo, how many days of paid holiday leave will you have for Thanksgiving?

choice.a: Just one day of paid holiday leave – the day of Thanksgiving.

choice.b: Two full days and one half day of paid holiday leave.

choice.c:
Three full days of paid holiday leave.

Hint

Read the message carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. In the middle of the memo, below the bulleted list of dates, the CEO gives instructions about leaving early on Tuesday, 11/21. All of the following details are given, except:

choice.a: What time you can leave.

choice.b: Whose permission you should get before you leave.

choice.c:
What you need to do before you ask to leave early.

Hint

Read the message carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Based on the information found in this travel reimbursement policy, if your meal receipt from a meeting in Washington, D.C., shows you paid for three dinners during one night of your stay, what will your company's fiscal manager likely say?

choice.a: “We will reimburse you for all meals if the other two were for your children.”

choice.b: “We will only reimburse you for one meal. Meals for other people are non-reimbursable.”

choice.c:
“Because your gas expenses were very low, we will reimburse you for all three meals.”

Hint

Read the policy carefully to infer the answer.

question_content: Q. Imagine that you are attending a two-day seminar that is 65 miles from your home and 30 miles from work. Will you be reimbursed for meals and lodging?

choice.a: No, because the travel destination is less than 35 miles from work.

choice.b: No, because the travel destination is less than 35 miles from home.

choice.c:
There isn't enough information to answer the question.

Hint

Read the policy carefully to infer the answer.

question_content: Q. Imagine that you are reviewing employee travel receipts. Will Sarah in Sales be reimbursed for the airfare, hotel, and food that was paid for by a vendor at a conference she recently attended?

choice.a: Yes, unless these expenses are related to the personal negligence of the traveler.

choice.b: No, because expenses paid for by a third party are not reimbursable.

choice.c:
No, because entertainment expenses, such as fees for social or non-mandatory activities at conferences, are not reimbursable.

Hint

Read the policy carefully to infer the answer.

question_content: Q. Given the context, what is a likely title for this section of the travel reimbursement policy?

choice.a: Cash, Deposits, and Petty Cash Policy

choice.b: Special Reimbursement Procedures

choice.c: Personal Travel Assistance Policy

choice.d:
Travel Reimbursement Exclusions

Hint

Read the policy carefully to infer the answer.

question_content: Q. According to Attachment 1310, what's a likely reason why you would need to include a justification with your reimbursement request?

choice.a: So the accounting department can confirm that the trip is primarily for business.

choice.b: So you don't have to get prior approval from your manager.

choice.c:
To prove to the accounting department that you received approval from your manager prior to the trip.

Hint

Read Attachment 1310 carefully to infer the answer.

question_content: Q. You work at Mort's Café as a Team Lead, and you have just received this memo. If you want the café to be ready for customers when doors open, when should you follow the instructions?

choice.a: Every morning when you arrive

choice.b: After the last lunch order

choice.c:
Before you leave for the day

Hint

Read the memo carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. In the second paragraph, the instruction states to first turn on the espresso machine, then preheat the oven. Why is this instruction given?

choice.a: To keep the café kitchen equipment clean and working properly.

choice.b: To teach the team leads how to use the oven and coffee machine.

choice.c:
To make sure the items that require time are ready for customers when the café opens.

Hint

This instruction has to do with customer service.

question_content: Q. According to the instructions in the memo, what should you do after you put the pastries in the oven?

choice.a: Finish setting up by starting the first batch of drip coffee.

choice.b: Finish setting up by taking the chairs down. Then stock the condiment bar.

choice.c:
Contact management with any questions before the café doors open.

Hint

Read the memo carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. This telephone policy is given to Client Relations specialists at Door Pros Security Corp. The policy lists instructions for taking calls. You are a Client Relations specialist and you receive a call in the main office. The caller wants you to take a message for them. According to the instructions, what should you do in this situation?

choice.a: Let the caller know you cannot take messages. Then ask the caller to call back again later.

choice.b: Let the caller know you cannot take messages. Then offer to direct their call to the person they wish to speak to.

choice.c:
First, put the caller on hold. Then find a piece of paper to take their message and resume the call.

Hint

Read the instructions for taking calls in the main office carefully.

question_content: Q. According to this set of instructions for sorting donations at the local thrift store, what should you do with donations that are ripped, stained, stretched, dirty, or in bad condition?

choice.a: Sort them with the rest of the items in the “Sell” category, but separate them from the high-quality clothing.

choice.b: Mend, wash, and repair them until they look brand new. Then put them with the rest of the items in the “Sell” category.

choice.c:
Place them in the white recycling crate.

Hint

Read the instructions in the second paragraph carefully.

question_content: Q. What should you do before sorting the donations in the blue bins along the back wall?

choice.a: Sort the donations into “Sell” and “Recycle” categories.

choice.b: Sort the donations based on retail value.

choice.c:
Place specific items, like a tee shirt or blouse, in the correct location.

Hint

Read the instructions carefully.

question_content: Q. This memo was sent out to all Regional Store Officers. The "Notes for stores" section supports the main idea by:

choice.a: Highlighting what gets removed from the shelves, and by when.

choice.b: Detailing when communications, like the press release, will go out to the public.

choice.c:
Providing instruction for how to comply with the order to no longer carry Sunnybough Farms products.

Hint

Read the instructions carefully to find the correct answer.

question_content: Q. According to the memo, stores should expect to:

choice.a: Receive Sunnybough Farms products until August 6th.

choice.b: Discount Sunnybough Farms products with coupons published on August 18th.

choice.c: Donate remaining products to food banks by September 1st.

choice.d: Add new displays and endcaps for Sunnybough Farms products after August 15th.

choice.e:
Carry Sunnybough Farms products beyond September 8th.

Hint

Read the instructions carefully to find the correct answer.

question_content: Q. Imagine you are a store manager and it is September 7th. What should you be prepared to do the next day?

choice.a: Receive the final shipment of Sunnybough Farms products.

choice.b: Make sure all Sunnybough Farms products have been removed from the store according to the details outlined in the memo.

choice.c:
Make a public announcement that all remaining Sunnybough Farms products will be sent to the food bank.

Hint

Read the instructions carefully to find the correct answer.

question_content:
This is a company-wide email about mapping network drives on employee computers.

Q. According to the message, which of the following is NOT why the IT Support Engineer sent this email to the entire company?

choice.a: Sending an email with instructions helps her field a frequently asked question and better manage her time.

choice.b: Sending an email with instructions provides employees with a reference for when this issue comes up again.

choice.c:
People have experienced long wait times for support with other tech problems.

Hint

Read the first paragraph carefully to find the correct answer.

question_content: Q. According to this memo from the Head of Security at Creekview Apartments, what does management believe will happen after the locks are replaced?

choice.a: Maintenance staff will complain about the increase in workload.

choice.b: Break-ins will be reduced because non-resident keys will no longer work.

choice.c:
Tenants will be able to share their electronic door code with friends and family.

Hint

Read the memo carefully to find the correct answer.

question_content: Q. Imagine that you are a maintenance staff person tasked with replacing locks at Creekview Apartments. What should you do after you schedule tenant appointments?

choice.a: Update your copy of the Lock-Replacement-Log_TEMPLATE.xlsx file with the appointment details. Then verify the appointment with the front desk.

choice.b: Download your copy of the Lock-Replacement-Log_TEMPLATE.xlsx file with the appointment details. Replace TEMPLATE with the tenant's name.

choice.c:
Update your copy of the Lock-Replacement-Log_TEMPLATE.xlsx file with the appointment details. Then upload the file to the shared drive replacing TEMPLATE with your name.

Hint

Read the instructions carefully to find the correct answer.

question_content: Q. Using context clues from the sentence, what is the most likely meaning of the highlighted word, "endcaps"?

choice.a: The final discount price on products before they are no longer offered.

choice.b: A display for store merchandise that is placed at either end of the main shelving unit.

choice.c:
The empty space on a shelf after a product has sold out completely.

Hint

Read the sentence containing the highlighted word carefully to find its meaning.

question_content: Q. Which of the following is the correct interpretation of the sentence with the highlighted word, "verify"?

choice.a: The sender of the memo will confirm the changes with the tenants.

choice.b: The sender of the memo will refute the changes with the tenants.

choice.c:
The sender of the memo will cancel the changes with the tenants.

Hint

Read the sentence containing the highlighted word carefully to find its meaning.

question_content: Q. In this memo, what does the sender mean when she says the company wants to conserve paper?

choice.a: The company wants to protect the paper they currently have.

choice.b: The company wants to restore the paper supply.

choice.c:
The company wants to prevent unnecessary paper use and waste.

Hint

Read the first sentence carefully to find its meaning.

question_content: Q. Based on the context, what is the best synonym for "generated"?

choice.a: Populated

choice.b: Born

choice.c: Reproduced

choice.d:
Deleted

Hint

Read the sentence containing the highlighted word carefully to find the word that best replaces it.

question_content: Q. Which of the following CHANGES the meaning of the sentence containing the word "implemented"?

choice.a: Beginning

choice.b: Introduced

choice.c: Revised

choice.d:
Applied

Hint

Try replacing the highlighted word with each answer choice to see which makes the least sense in the sentence.

question_content:
Q. Which of the following words CHANGES the meaning of the sentence containing the word impair?

TJELABS DRUG FREE WORKPLACE POLICY

Drugs and alcohol have been shown to impair worker performance and judgement. Given the nature of our work, drugs in the workplace would create danger for employees and problems for our clients. For that reason, employees may not:

  • Possess drugs or alcohol on TJELabs grounds
  • Come to work while affected by drugs or alcohol
  • Use drugs or alcohol while representing TJELabs

Drug Testing

TJELabs may conduct drug and alcohol tests at any time, for any reason. Employees may not refuse a drug test.

Disciplinary Action

Employees who violate any part of this policy will be disciplined. Discipline may include immediate termination. Employees fired for drug and alcohol violations will not be rehired at any TJELabs office.

choice.a: Drugs and alcohol enhance worker performance and judgment.

choice.b: Drugs and alcohol slow worker performance and judgment.

choice.c:
Drugs and alcohol weaken worker performance and judgment.

Hint

Read the sentence containing the highlighted word carefully to find its meaning.

question_content:
Q. Which of the following words could replace the word "conduct" without altering the meaning of the sentence?

TJELABS DRUG FREE WORKPLACE POLICY

Drugs and alcohol have been shown to impair worker performance and judgement. Given the nature of our work, drugs in the workplace would create danger for employees and problems for our clients. For that reason, employees may not:

  • Possess drugs or alcohol on TJELabs grounds
  • Come to work while affected by drugs or alcohol
  • Use drugs or alcohol while representing TJELabs

Drug Testing

TJELabs may conduct drug and alcohol tests at any time, for any reason. Employees may not refuse a drug test.

Disciplinary Action

Employees who violate any part of this policy will be disciplined. Discipline may include immediate termination. Employees fired for drug and alcohol violations will not be rehired at any TJELabs office.

choice.a: Create

choice.b: Display

choice.c: Transmit

choice.d:
Administer

Hint

Try replacing the highlighted word with each answer choice to see which makes the least sense in the sentence.

question_content:
Q. In the sentence, all of the following synonyms work as possible replacements for the word “termination,” except:

TJELABS DRUG FREE WORKPLACE POLICY

Drugs and alcohol have been shown to impair worker performance and judgement. Given the nature of our work, drugs in the workplace would create danger for employees and problems for our clients. For that reason, employees may not:

  • Possess drugs or alcohol on TJELabs grounds
  • Come to work while affected by drugs or alcohol
  • Use drugs or alcohol while representing TJELabs

Drug Testing

TJELabs may conduct drug and alcohol tests at any time, for any reason. Employees may not refuse a drug test.

Disciplinary Action

Employees who violate any part of this policy will be disciplined. Discipline may include immediate termination. Employees fired for drug and alcohol violations will not be rehired at any TJELabs office.

choice.a: Firing

choice.b: Ending

choice.c: Dismissal

choice.d:
Letting go

Hint

Try replacing the highlighted word with each answer choice to see which makes the least sense in the sentence.

question_content: Q. Here's an email correspondence between two employees of Rosen and Associates. Which of the following is the correct meaning of the acronym “COB” in the second paragraph of Eunie's email?

choice.a: Copy Our Bosses

choice.b: Close of Business

choice.c: Create Our Baseline

choice.d:
Coordinate Our Business

Hint

Read the second paragraph of Eunie's email carefully.

question_content: Q. According to Eunie's email, detailed specifications have been uploaded to DocuShare. Based on the context, what is the likely function of DocuShare?

choice.a: A digital storage place where everyone on a project can access company files.

choice.b: A program that designs project specifications.

choice.c:
A place to find running gear for charitable events.

Hint

Read the second paragraph of Eunie's email carefully.

question_content: Q. Eunie specifies that Marc Argenti has designed an end-user CTA for run sign up. Based on what you can infer from the email, which of the following functions as a CTA?

choice.a: A list of winners from past runs.

choice.b: A video that shows the history of the run.

choice.c:
A form that allows someone to sign up for the run.

Hint

CTA stands for “Call to Action” and is used to help site visitors navigate a webpage.

question_content: Q. According to Carl's response email, when will Jasmine Brown send an update about her expected drop date?

choice.a: After the Second Approval Phase

choice.b: As soon as possible, after she looks at the project specs

choice.c:
As soon as the project manager reviews the files

Hint

What does ASAP stand for in Carl's email?

question_content: Q. Carl uses the abbreviation “w/r/t” to shorten the second paragraph. What does “w/r/t” stand for?

choice.a: with respect to

choice.b: website response tweet

choice.c: writing, reading and text

choice.d:
Wireless Reference Transmitter

Hint

Select the answer choice that best replaces the abbreviation.

question_content: Q. Carl indicates that Jasmine Brown will need information from Mark so she can start writing the CSS. Given the context, what is CSS?

choice.a: A classification system for organizing colors.

choice.b: Code for designing the look and feel of the website.

choice.c:
A “Charity & Service Support” informational packet for run attendees.

Hint

Read the final paragraph of Carl's email carefully.

question_content: Q. Which of the following most likely describes this type of document?

choice.a: Safety tips for what people can do in their homes and businesses.

choice.b: Guidelines for how managers can create new policies for the company.

choice.c:
Legal rules about how this type of business must operate.

Hint

Read the document carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Based on the context clues provided in the document, what type of business is this regulation for?

choice.a: Childcare

choice.b: Family Services

choice.c: Building & Construction

choice.d:
Non-Governmental Organizations

Hint

Read the document carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Which of the following would NOT fall under Section A?

choice.a: Assign smoking areas 20 feet from building

choice.b: Avoid using candles or other flammable objects

choice.c: Indicate egress options using an evacuation map

choice.d:
Use fireproof, commercial-grade fabrics

Hint

All but one of the answer choices helps you avoid conditions that could contribute to a fire hazard.

question_content: Q. Which one of these situations follows the fire drill procedure correctly?

choice.a: Drills should happen every two months using a variety of evacuation routes.

choice.b: Drills should be conducted monthly but only during the shift when most people work.

choice.c:
Drills should be conducted monthly and recorded by management.

Hint

Read section B carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Which of these would pass the regulation's rules for egress?

choice.a: Two exits are placed side by side to make one major egress corridor.

choice.b: The hallways are lined with cubbies, backpacks and things that need storing.

choice.c:
The stairwell off the back door has a railing at child-height.

Hint

Read section D carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Which of the following topics is not covered in the regulation?

choice.a: How to file a post-fire insurance report.

choice.b: Which requirement codes the fire detection systems must meet.

choice.c: Which floors childcare can be provided on.

choice.d:
Where railings designed for children need to be.

Hint

Read the document carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. This email was sent from the company's Chief Compliance Officer (CCO) to the Packing and Processing teams. Which of the following describes the overall sentiment of the email?

choice.a: The CCO is confident in the level of preparedness of both teams, but worries that the team members will be pressured to cover up mistakes or lie.

choice.b: The CCO is confident in the level of preparedness of both teams, and wants to empower them with information about what to expect.

choice.c:
The CCO is hesitant about the level of preparedness given the documented violations from the last two visits.

Hint

Read the email carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Based on the FDA attachment, “What Should I Expect During an Inspection?”, the FDA is most likely:

choice.a: interested in assessing the company's ability to comply with regulations.

choice.b: issuing the FDA form 482 to provide the company with compliance actions to take.

choice.c:
sending their representative to teach the company how to manufacture better widgets.

Hint

Read the attachment carefully to make an inference about the FDA's visit.

question_content: Q. All of the following details can be derived from the CCO's email and attachment, except:

choice.a: the impact of passing an inspection.

choice.b: the status of the last two FDA visits.

choice.c: the consequences of lying to an inspector.

choice.d: what the inspector will do during the inspection.

choice.e:
what to use as a guide for corrective action after the inspection.

Hint

Read the email and attachment carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. In his email, Erik mentions that a PM, a role that is also noted in the attachment, will work closely with the inspector. According to both documents, what does PM stand for?

choice.a: Project Manager

choice.b: Planning Manager

choice.c: Production Manager

choice.d: Production Maintenance

choice.e:
Performance Manager

Hint

Read the email and attachment carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Imagine that you are assigned to accompany the inspector. According to the attachment, you must remain with the inspector:

choice.a: in order to keep them from seeing certain parts of the production facility.

choice.b: for the majority of the visit, with the exception of time spent looking at records.

choice.c:
for the entirety of the visit, including during the examination of processes and collection of samples.

Hint

Read the attachment carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. According to Erik's email and the attachment, which of these scenarios best shows a willingness to comply with the FDA-483?

choice.a: The teams implement FDA-483 suggestions immediately, during the discussion with the inspector.

choice.b: The PM gives the inspector a thorough tour of the production facilities and introduces them to team members.

choice.c:
The teams continue with normal daily facility duties without acknowledging FDA-483 suggestions.

Hint

Read the email and attachment carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Which of the following is NOT a likely reason why Utah Medicaid Enterprise sent out this RFP?

choice.a: They weren't satisfied with the work of the previous vendor and wanted a new one.

choice.b: They wanted to get a sample of what the industry has to offer.

choice.c:
They were discontinuing a program offered to Utah taxpayers.

Hint

Read the request for proposals and make an inference.

question_content: Q. In the RFP, Mary O'Shannon indicates that candidates must be able to conduct business within the State of Utah. This is important to include for all of the following reasons, except:

choice.a: It's an indication of the vendor's size and capacity to grow.

choice.b: It highlights an underlying principle of Utah Medicaid Enterprise.

choice.c:
It immediately eliminates candidates that aren't qualified to do business within the State of Utah.

Hint

Read the Request for Proposals carefully. See the on-page instruction for help!

question_content: Q. Based on the information provided in both cover letters, which company is shown to have a history of working with Utah Medicaid Enterprise?

choice.a: Dorton Medical Inc.

choice.b: Global Health United

choice.c: Both companies

choice.d:
There isn't enough information to answer the question.

Hint

Read the Request for Proposals and responses carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Imagine that you are helping Mary O'Shannon read responses from RFP candidates. What is a reason why a new candidate must submit references from existing clients?

choice.a: New candidates are more likely to submit inaccurate responses to the RFP.

choice.b: Utah Medicaid Enterprise only works with vendors serving a minimum of 30 clients.

choice.c:
New candidates need to establish trust by demonstrating successful business relationships.

Hint

Read the request for proposals and make an inference about why Utah Medicaid Enterprise requires references from new candidates.

question_content: Q. Which of the following principles is NOT reflected in the RFP's list of what candidates must be able to do?

choice.a: Utah Medicaid Enterprise values the financial welfare of the people it serves.

choice.b: Developing relationships with new vendors is a sign of organizational growth.

choice.c:
It is important for vendors to bring business into the state.

Hint

Read the Request for Proposals carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Which of the following non-negotiable values expressed in the RFP was NOT included in the response from Global Health United?

choice.a: Accounting for tax reductions and incentives for individuals within the State of Utah

choice.b: Demonstrating where organizational funding comes from

choice.c: Being able to conduct business within the State of Utah

choice.d:
Naming one primary contact to be available for RFP communications and questions

Hint

Read the Request for Proposals and Global Health United's responses carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. How does Dorton Medical Inc. demonstrate their understanding of the values outlined in the RFP?

choice.a: They say they are already registered to do business in Utah in the second paragraph.

choice.b: They include a cost-saving solution for taxpayers.

choice.c: They address where their fees and funding come from in the third paragraph.

choice.d:
All of the above

Hint

Read the Request for Proposals and Dorton Medical Inc.'s responses carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. The following document is taken from an actual commercial real estate lease agreement. What can you infer is the meaning of the jargon “hereinafter recited” highlighted in section 1.2?

choice.a: Legally enforced by law

choice.b: Read aloud by an attorney

choice.c: Recounted from this point in the document

choice.d:
Rent paid by multiple tenants within one building unit

Hint

Read section 1.2 carefully. Then find the answer choice that best substitutes the highlighted text.

question_content: Q. Which of the following words are possible synonyms for the contract jargon “hereby” highlighted in section 1.2?

choice.a: “before” or “about”

choice.b: “before” or “instead of”

choice.c: “thus” or “therefore”

choice.d:
“thus” or “because of”

Hint

Read section 1.2 carefully. Then find the answer choice that best substitutes the highlighted text.

question_content: Q. Based on the context of this portion of the commercial lease, what can you infer is meant by the words “Demised Premises” highlighted in sections 1.2 and 1.3?

choice.a: Abandoned land that has unclear boundaries.

choice.b: A deed restriction that can only be lifted by the Landlord.

choice.c:
A property or part of a property that is leased to a tenant.

Hint

Read the passage carefully. Then infer the best definition of the highlighted text.

question_content: Q. Which of the following words CHANGES the meaning of the sentence when substituted for the highlighted term “consent”?

choice.a: Agreement

choice.b: Approval

choice.c: Dissent

choice.d: Permit

choice.e:
Permission

Hint

Read the passage carefully. Then eliminate the words that best substitute the highlighted text.

question_content: Q. Which of the following is a possible antonym of the highlighted term “permitted”?

choice.a: Approved

choice.b: Denied

choice.c: Conducted

choice.d: Legalized

choice.e:
Privileged

Hint

Read section 4.2 carefully to infer the correct answer.

question_content: Q. Given the context of section 4.4 and the use of the highlighted words "cut-rate prices," the tenant is not allowed to:

choice.a: Take out low-cost television ads on local networks.

choice.b: Promote itself as a wholesaler or a discount store.

choice.c:
Use third parties to sell goods and services.

Hint

Read section 4.4 carefully to infer the correct answer.

question_content: Q. This document was pulled from the Chicago Municipal Code. What kind of document is this?

choice.a: A safety regulation for handling hazardous substances.

choice.b: An employee code of conduct for waste management facilities.

choice.c:
A list of instructions for storage companies.

Hint

Read the document carefully to draw a conclusion.

question_content: Q. According to paragraph 2, who should you notify if a change is made in the amount of supply stored? When should you notify them?

choice.a: Notify management within 24 hours by phone.

choice.b: Notify the fire commissioner with a notarized letter within two days.

choice.c:
Notify the fire commissioner within 24 hours.

Hint

Read the document carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Imagine that you work in a laboratory and are responsible for filling containers with toxic liquid. Which of these scenarios complies with how you should handle any defective containers you come across?

choice.a: Keeping older containers with visible cracks on the bottom storage shelf, closest to the floor.

choice.b: Using repair recommendations found in the latest safety manual to mend the containers.

choice.c:
Recycling the containers in the city's weekly waste pick up.

Hint

Read the document carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. According to the final paragraph of the document, what should you do with tanks containing 80 gallons of highly toxic material?

choice.a: If underground, they should be diked and should follow Section 15-24-170.

choice.b: If indoors, they should be stored in a safe location that follows Section 15-24-170.

choice.c:
If aboveground, they should be surrounded by dikes that are not less than one and one-half times the combined capacity of the tank.

Hint

Read the document carefully to find the answer.

question_content: Q. This document was written for the clients of a local attorney. It outlines the concept of “Joint Tenancy.” According to the document, if Robert and Vicki own a condo as joint tenants and Robert's will gives his half-interest to his sister Mary, who will receive Robert's half-interest after he dies?

choice.a: Vicki, because she has the “right of survivorship.”

choice.b: Mary, because she is legally named in Robert's will.

choice.c:
Neither Vicki nor Mary will receive Robert's half-interest.

Hint

Read the first two paragraphs of the Utilization of Joint Tenancy document carefully to find the correct answer.

question_content: Q. According to the document, if you are named the beneficiary of a late relative's classic car, what must happen to the vehicle before you receive it?

choice.a: The vehicle must be transferred through a third-party tenant agreement.

choice.b: The vehicle must go through probate.

choice.c:
The vehicle must be re-certified as a “Classic.”

Hint

Read the Limitations of Joint Tenancy carefully to find the correct answer.

question_content: Q. Which of the following can be inferred from Part I?

choice.a: The EMS Plan – Do – Check – Act process is used by all VDOT facilities despite being very new.

choice.b: VDOT is unable to assess whether its EMS efforts are working and if it's worth the cost to the State of Vermont.

choice.c:
EMS concepts and processes could work at public schools, commercial buildings, and even large-scale tourist destinations.

Hint

Read Part I carefully to infer the correct answer.

question_content: Q. What is NOT a likely reason why EMS efforts were expanded to VDOT's testing and chemistry labs?

choice.a: Testing and chemistry labs were the first to model waste management practices that were then adapted by other industries.

choice.b: Problems with safety and environmental compliance were identified in these types of facilities.

choice.c:
Testing and chemistry labs needed a strategy for managing waste streams.

Hint

Read Part I carefully to infer the correct answer.

question_content: Q. Based on the information conveyed in both documents, what can you infer about the VDOT's guiding principles?

choice.a: Preparing facilities and internal processes for annual safety audits always takes priority over implementing corrective actions.

choice.b: VDOT values the safety of its employees and serves to protect the state's ecological infrastructure.

choice.c:
In order to ensure audits remain impartial and unbiased, employee opinion is taken into account separately from the audit process.

Hint

Read Part I and Part II carefully to infer the correct answer.

question_content: Q. What is a likely reason for including Part II in the regulation?

choice.a: Audit procedures create tension between employees and leadership. The inclusion of Part II establishes a predictable audit process that mitigates the issue.

choice.b: Environmental activists demand tighter waste management regulations. The State of Vermont addresses their concerns in Part II.

choice.c:
Historically, audits have occurred without a follow-up plan. Part II allows for more timely and actionable implementation.

Hint

Read Part II carefully and make a best guess as to why it is included.

question_content: Q. Which of the following scenarios would comply with the VDOT's guidelines for conducting audits?

choice.a: Upper management conducts follow-up reviews at the same time as employee performance reviews.

choice.b: Auditors from adjacent states contribute to the Corrective Action Plan based on standards outlined in the Environmental Management EMS Standard.

choice.c:
A team of employees observes that non-recyclable materials (e.g. Styrofoam and certain plastics) go to the landfill each month. They report this gap to the appropriate parties.

Hint

Read Part II carefully to infer the correct answer.

question_content: Q. Based on the information listed in Part II, which of these would NOT likely be included in the audit guidelines?

choice.a: Environmental Management certification is required for all VDOT facilities.

choice.b: The audit scope establishes corrective actions and suggests timeframes for teams to fulfill audit recommendations.

choice.c:
Team leaders set priorities and deadlines for completing the Corrective Action Plan.

Hint

Read Part II carefully to infer the correct answer.

question_content: You are a stocker at Stuff & Things. In setting up displays, what rule must you adhere to?
answer_content: The correct answer is “All price tags must be matched to the correct product.”

choice.a: All products must have hanging price tags.

choice.b: All price tags must be matched to the correct product.

choice.c: All cookware must be set in front of aisle 20.

choice.d: All scannable bar codes must be displayed in a prominent position.

choice.e: All products must have a blue tag.

answer_content: The correct answer is "In the top right-hand drawer."

choice.a: In the cupboard above the coffee pot

choice.b: In the cupboard next to the electrical outlet

choice.c: In the bottom left-hand drawer

choice.d: In the top right-hand drawer

choice.e: Next to the refrigerator

choice.a: 10 pounds.

choice.c: 40 pounds.

choice.d: 50 pounds.

question_content: What will occur if the minor issues are not fixed by the deadline?
answer_content: “The occupancy permit will be withdrawn” is the correct answer.

choice.a: The city will fix the issues at the owner's expense.

choice.b: The builder must request an extension.

choice.c: The builder will receive a fine.

choice.d: The owner must fix the issues immediately.

choice.e: The occupancy permit will be withdrawn.

question_content: What is the purpose of this document on usability testing?
answer_content: The correct answer is “To provide an explanation of and guidelines for conducting usability testing.”

choice.a: To provide step-by-step instructions for completing a usability test

choice.b: To promote usability testing as a part of website development

choice.c: To provide an explanation of and guidelines for conducting usability testing

choice.d: To eliminate errors in website development

choice.e: To show that usability testing can be applied to website development

question_content: Your fellow employee wants to return a comic book that she purchased. What should you do?
answer_content: The correct answer is “Tell her that she cannot return a comic book.”

choice.a: Ask for her employee card

choice.b: Refund her money in the form of store credit

choice.c: Refund her money in cash

choice.d: Tell her that she cannot return the comic book

choice.e: Provide her a refund minus 15%

question_content: You work for REV and check your work email on your mobile phone. You have decided to resign your job and take a position with a different company. Regarding RDM on your mobile phone, what should you do?
answer_content: The correct answer is “Nothing; IT Services will automatically remove all data.”

choice.a: Turn your phone in to IT Services.

choice.b: Take your phone to IT Services, and they will wipe it clean.

choice.c: Download RDM to your personal computer.

choice.d: Call IT Services for support, and they will assist.

choice.e: Nothing; IT Services will automatically remove all data.

choice.c: To maintain pressure and prevent air bubbles

choice.e: To determine the final price

answer_content: The correct answer is “to protect the safety of the new home buyers.”

choice.b: To differentiate between major (life and safety) and minor issues

choice.c: To ensure that new home buyers are not being over charged

choice.d: To protect builders from lawsuits

choice.e: To define when new home construction is completed

question_content: Your team is redesigning a website for Scenic Lawns and Gardens. Your team is now planning a website usability test. Based on these documents, which set of instructions for participants would be most appropriate?
answer_content: “You recently purchased a home with a large yard. You would like to explore different ideas and obtain price estimates for adding trees, bushes, and fencing. You also want to test the soil to determine fertilizer needs. Below is a link to the homepage of the website.”

choice.a: You are seeking information on yard care. First, open the website using the Chrome browser. You should search under 'Lawncare Ideas.' Tell us if the information is understandable and useful.

choice.b: You recently purchased a home with a large yard. You would like to explore different ideas and obtain price estimates for adding trees, bushes, and fencing. You also want to test the soil to determine fertilizer needs. Below is a link to the homepage of the website.

choice.c: You want to grow tomatoes and add a strawberry patch to your backyard. In the Search Box, enter 'tomatoes and strawberries.' Look at the pages that come up. Determine whether the information is useful and understandable.

choice.d: You are interested in lawns and gardens. Go to our website. Tell us if the website helps you to understand lawn and garden care.

choice.e: You have purchased an acre lot for developing a garden. You want to grow a wide variety of crops to sell at the local farmer's market. You would like to see what vegetables and fruit trees grow best in our area. On the homepage, select the tab that reads 'Gardens.' Read the information on the page called 'Vegetables' and then read the page called 'Fruit Trees.'

question_content: For website pages on tax shelters, the Plain Writing Act requires that which of the following be considered?

choice.a: Intended audience

choice.b: Color contrasts

choice.c: Intuitive links

choice.d: Detailed information

choice.e: Usability testing

question_content: You work in the editorial department of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA). Based on the Plain Writing Act, which new OSHA document must be written in plain language?
answer_content: The correct answer is “A user's guide to safe workplace practices in agriculture.”

choice.a: A Congressional act granting OSHA greater authority to set construction safety rules

choice.b: A report to Congress detailing manufacturing safety violations

choice.c: A user's guide to safe workplace practices in agriculture

choice.d: A manual detailing OSHA employee benefits

choice.e: Safety regulations for the railway industry
